comment:
Extracted Variables:
- \( x \): number of phones to keep in inventory
- \( y \): number of laptops to keep in inventory

Definitions:
- \( P_{phone} = 120 \): profit earned from selling one phone
- \( P_{laptop} = 40 \): profit earned from selling one laptop
- \( S_{phone} = 1 \): floor space required for one phone (in sq ft)
- \( S_{laptop} = 4 \): floor space required for one laptop (in sq ft)
- \( T = 400 \): total available floor space (in sq ft)
- \( C_{phone} = 400 \): cost of one phone
- \( C_{laptop} = 100 \): cost of one laptop
- \( B = 6000 \): maximum budget for spending
- \( R = 0.8 \): minimum percentage of laptops in stock

Objective:
Maximize profit: \( Z = P_{phone} \cdot x + P_{laptop} \cdot y \)

Constraints:
1. Floor space constraint: \( S_{phone} \cdot x + S_{laptop} \cdot y \leq T \)
2. Budget constraint: \( C_{phone} \cdot x + C_{laptop} \cdot y \leq B \)
3. Minimum percentage of laptops constraint: \( y \geq R \cdot (x + y) \)
